project.teaser: R2D2 strategic goal is to improve the resilience and reliability of current EPES (Electrical Power and Energy Systems) against a growing number of threats and vulnerabilities that may affect such critical infrastructure, exposing weaknesses with harmful and damaging effects on...
project.objective:
R2D2 strategic goal is to improve the resilience and reliability of current EPES (Electrical Power and Energy Systems) against a growing number of threats and vulnerabilities that may affect such critical infrastructure, exposing weaknesses with harmful and damaging effects on different stakeholders and final customers. This will be done through the deployment of four tools dedicated to the prevention, protection and restoration of EPES in two different independent but complementary scenarios in the energy value-chain – from regional coordination between TSOs, to privacy of LV customers. The project will build on top of strong energy coordination actions in South-East Europe (SEE), following EU legislation and in alignment with the recent activities promoted by ENTSO-Eabout cyber-security in transmission systems.
Through the demonstration and integration of the innovative solutions proposed by R2D2, it will be possible to achieve a more secure, reliable and resilient energy system in Europe, making a positive and tangible impact throughout the European EPES value chain. In this context, R2D2 will deliver a palette of complementary solutions synthesised into four Products: “Multi-risk assessment framework for power system” (P1 – C3PO), “Resilience suite for TSO & DSO” (P2 - IRIS), “Prevention Systems For Energy Infrastructures Security” (P3 - PRECOG) and “Enhanced Assets Maintenance And Management Toolkit” (P4 - EMMA).
project.title: Reliability, Resilience and Defense technology for the griD
project.keywords: Reliability, Resilience, Electrical Power and Energy Systems, Distribution, Transmission, Cyber-security

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - R2D2 (Reliability, Resilience and Defense technology for the griD)
result.teaser: R2D2 strategic goal is to improve the resilience and reliability of current EPES (Electrical Power and Energy Systems) against a growing number of threats and vulnerabilities that may affect such critical infrastructure, exposing weakness with harmful and damaging effects on...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Design of the Resilience suite for TSO and DSO
result.description: This deliverable will describe the design of IRIS, its main functionalities and specifications of this product, with the methodologies, techniques and algorithms to adopt, including the definition of functionalities and UI (T4.1-4)

result.title: Resilience-Oriented Coordination of Networked Microgrids: A Shapley Q-Value Learning Approach

details.authors: Dawei Qiu; Yi Wang; Jianhong Wang; Ning Zhang; Goran Strbac; Chongqing Kang

result.title: Final version of the R2D2 Requirements and Detailed Architecture Design
result.description: Updated version of D2.1 properly revising the requirements, architecture (considering findings of the pre-validation phase) and KPIs with final metrics.

result.title: Multi-agent reinforcement learning for electric vehicle decarbonized routing and scheduling

details.authors: Qiu, Dawei; WANG, Yi; He, Yinglong; Zhou, Quan; Štrbac, Goran

result.title: 1st version of Requirements and Detailed Architecture Design
result.description: Report on the end-user and business requirements, accompanied by the corresponding technical design and specifications of the individual components and integrated R2D2 solution. (T2.1, T2.2, T2.3)

result.title: A stochastic distributed control approach for load restoration of networked microgrids with mobile energy storage systems

details.authors: Qiu, Dawei; WANG, Yi; Rousis, Anastasios Oulis; Štrbac, Goran
details.journalTitle: International Journal of Electrical Power and Energy Systems

result.title: R2D2 knowledge arena
result.description: Report on the different material to produce and C&D activities to carry out (T8.2).

result.title: Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication Plan
result.description: The document will provide systematic information on raising awareness of the project's activities, goals and results. It will describe the target audiences, key messages, outreach activities and communication channels. It will include the Communication and dissemination Master Plan (T8.1).

result.title: Design of the Enhanced maintenance and asset management toolkit
result.description: Design of the Enhanced maintenance and asset management toolkit, (ETRA, R, PU, M12) This deliverable will describe the design of EMMA, its main functionalities and specifications of this product, with the methodologies, techniques and algorithms to adopt, including the definition of functionalities and UI (T6.1-4)

result.title: Design of the Prevention Systems For Energy Infrastructures Security
result.description: This deliverable will describe the design of PRECOG, its main functionalities and specifications of this product, with the methodologies, techniques and algorithms to adopt, including the definition of functionalities and UI (T5.1-5)

result.title: Towards Microgrid Resilience Enhancement via Mobile Power Sources and Repair Crews: A Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning Approach

details.authors: Yi Wang; Dawei Qiu; Fei Teng; Goran Strbac

result.title: Project Management Plan
result.description: Includes all project management procedures and templates, a detailed technical, implementation plan, the risk assessment and ethics monitoring frameworks. (T1.1, T1.2, T1.3)

result.title: Design of the Multi-risk assessment framework for power system
result.description: This deliverable will describe the design of C3PO, its main functionalities and specifications of this product, with the methodologies, techniques and algorithms to adopt, including the definition of functionalities and UI (T3.1-6)

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: It will include the initial DMP along the FAIR principles and the corresponding roles of partners and resources to be utilized. It is provided as a separate deliverable due to the strong datarelevant nature of the project. Updates of the DMP will be provided as part of the Periodic Management Reports. (T1.4)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
